ngiemboon: Saẅi la kwé, Ndavîd gẅie à la lÿɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a Amalɛg tà ńjÿó, á piŋ nzèm né Tsiglag, ńnéŋe wó lyɛ̌ʼ sépʉ́a.
en: After the death of Saul,   David returned from defeating the Amalekites  # 1:1 1Sm 30:1–20 and stayed at Ziklag two days.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ na lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè yétá, atsɔ̌ múɔ mbàŋa fó jʉʼʉ lepumó pʉ̀a Saẅi ńtó, menzsǒ mé gwɔ́ me shʉate, mbà tsetsáʼ pǔ ńzɔ́ʼɔ twó yé. À la tó tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ Ndavîd, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ tà zǐ yé kíbe ssé.
en: On the third day a man with torn clothes and dust on his head   came from Saul’s camp. When he came to David, he fell to the ground and paid homage.

ngiemboon: Ndavîd zɛ́te yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ fóo né nzɔ̌?» Á tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Mèŋ fǒ jʉʼʉ lepumó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ, éshú ńkÿo.»
en: David asked him, “Where have you come from? ”

ngiemboon: Ndavîd zɛ́te yé ngie: «Púʼu mbà kɔ́ zɔ̌ gÿo? Tsétsɔʼ shwóŋo wɔ́ɔn!» Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Mé kɔʼɔ́ ńne ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ ncù, epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ kÿo, epʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn gwete ńkwéte. Saẅi yé máŋwɛ́ pɔ́ míŋ we Jÿonataŋ pǔ ńkwé.»
en: “What was the outcome? Tell me,” David asked him.

ngiemboon: Ndavîd gíŋ ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ gÿǒ lêkɔ́ tá ńzsé ngie Saẅi pɔ́ míŋ we Jÿonataŋ pǔ ńkwé?»
en: David asked the young man who had brought him the report, “How do you know Saul and his son Jonathan are dead? ”

ngiemboon: Múɔ mbàŋa ŋwɛ́ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «N ně ńtó pɔ́ ńcʉa á ndùm lekwɛ́ Ngimbowa, ńgyá páʼ lekwoŋ Saẅi shʉ́ge na yé ńcʉ́ʼ ńtóonte yé toonté. Mbà megàŋmbù pie ée pashwoŋ mekélêg lÿóon tǒ tà ḿbɔ́ɔnte na yé.
en: “I happened to be on Mount Gilboa,”   he replied, “and there was Saul, leaning on his spear. At that very moment the chariots and the cavalry were closing in on him.

ngiemboon: Á sele nnɛ́ ńgyá wɔ́ɔn, ńdeen ńtóŋo wɔ́ɔn, n zẅíŋ.
en: When he turned around and saw me, he called out to me, so I answered: I’m at your service.

ngiemboon: Á zɛ́te wɔ́ɔn ngie n gee wɔ̌ wɔ́ɔ? N tsɔ́ʼ ngie: N gee nyìŋ Amalɛg.
en: He asked me, ‘Who are you? ’ I told him: I’m an Amalekite.

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie tsetsɔ́ʼ, tó mege wɔ́ɔn ńzẅé, mélàʼmie m bǔ ne ńjúʼu kékáŋ tɛʼ, tà mbɔɔ páʼ n ké nyé ńzẅige zẅige lɔɔn.
en: Then he begged me, ‘Stand over me and kill me, for I’m mortally wounded,   but my life still lingers.’  # 1:9 Jdg 9:54

ngiemboon: N deen ńké ńtó né lejʉ́ŋ yé, ńgyá ngie ngwɔ́ á le tsẅɛ́; n deen ńké ḿmege yé ńzẅé. Ńkyɛ́ʼ kàŋmbúm twó yé, ésẅɛɛ kwáŋ pwó yé; eshúm ŋwɛ́ sɔɔn sie n dɔ̌g ńtóo lénáa mbwó gù lɔɔn mbà nkwɔbɔ́.»
en: So I stood over him and killed him because I knew that after he had fallen he couldn’t survive. I took the crown that was on his head and the armband that was on his arm, and I’ve brought them here to my lord.”

ngiemboon: Ndavîd júʼ púʼu, ésele shʉate menzsǒ mbùm yé, epʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ̌ laa jʉʼó gíŋe ḿbú ńgÿo yɔ́b pɔ́ púʼu.
en: Then David took hold of his clothes and tore them,   and all the men with him did the same.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la pú ńdʉa legwé, ḿbiŋ ńkwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè tà ńkú ncwònzém, ńgÿo púʼu, ńtí Saẅi pɔ́ míŋ we Jÿonataŋ, mbɔɔ pʉ̀a mesoŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbɔɔ púɔ Ésàlayɛ pie é la kwéte tsẅɛɛ ncù.
en: They mourned, wept, and fasted until the evening   for those who died by the sword #— #for Saul, his son Jonathan, the Lord’s people, and the house of Israel.

ngiemboon: Ndavîd gíŋe ńzɛ́te múɔ mbàŋa ŋwɛ́ gẅie à lɔ̌g wɛ̌ nkʉ̀ ńtó ngie: «Ɔ̀ ně ńzɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie ɔɔ nyìŋ nzɔ̌ lɛ̂?» Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «N gee míŋ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ Amalɛg gẅie à la kÿo láʼ ńtó né láʼ pi.»
en: David inquired of the young man who had brought him the report, “Where are you from? ”

ngiemboon: Ndavîd zɛ́te yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ gÿo lêkɔ́ ńzẅé fùɔ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la zɔ́ʼ té zɔɔn ḿbɔ́g?»
en: David questioned him, “How is it that you were not afraid to lift your hand to destroy the Lord’s anointed? ”

ngiemboon: Ndavîd zɛ́te púʼu, ńdeen ńké ńtóŋo tsɔ̌ ngàŋafàʼ we, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Cʉa ńzẅé múɔ mbàŋa wɔɔn!» Angàŋafàʼ Ndavîd leen ńké ńcúɔ múɔ mbàŋa ŋwɛ́, ńzẅé.
en: Then David summoned one of his servants and said, “Come here and kill him! ” The servant struck him, and he died.

ngiemboon: Ndavîd la gwaa tsẅi ngie mé zẅé nyìŋ Amalɛg ŋwɛ́, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Metse mú ge sele kwɔ́ʼɔ twó gù, mélàʼmie gù máŋwɛ́ zɔ tsɔ̌ʼ ncwò gú ńgɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ zẅě fùɔ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la zɔ́ʼ.
en: For David had said to the Amalekite, “Your blood is on your own head   because your own mouth testified against you by saying, ‘I killed the Lord’s anointed.’ ”

ngiemboon: Ndavîd la gɔɔn púʼu, ńdeen ńké ńtuu tsɔ́ zɔ̀bɔ lemÿɔ̀g, ńtí legwé Saẅi pɔ́ se míŋ we Jÿonataŋ.
en: David sang the following lament   for Saul and his son Jonathan,

ngiemboon: Ńtu púʼu, ńgɔɔn ngie mé zíʼi pà Yúndà lézɔb. Áa zɔ̀bɔ ntse gie mé tóŋo lê kyɛ́d, mbà mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ lepuʼú ŋwàʼne ngàŋa nò nénʉ́.
en: and he ordered that the Judahites be taught The Song of the Bow. It is written in the Book of Jashar:  ,# 1:18 Jos 10:12–13

ngiemboon: Ésàlayɛ, palÿɔ́ʼncù pú pembòŋo kéen ḿbú ńkwéte ndùm mekwɛ́!
en: The splendor of Israel lies slain on your heights.

ngiemboon: Tà pi gÿo tà mé fó tÿǒsoŋo Ngâd ńjúʼu yɔɔn nò,
en: Do not tell it in Gath,

ngiemboon: Pi mekwɛ́ Ngimbowa,
en: Mountains of Gilboa,

ngiemboon: Á lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ gie mé gee ḿpfɛte metse megàŋmbù,
en: Jonathan’s bow never retreated,

ngiemboon: Saẅi pɔ́ Jÿonataŋ lɔ́ɔn ńkwoŋe mennɛ́ mɔ́b tɛʼ, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ laa ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ,
en: Saul and Jonathan,

ngiemboon: Pi Panzwě Ésàlayɛ, pi lʉa Saẅi!
en: Daughters of Israel, weep for Saul,

ngiemboon: Mélàʼakɔ́ ngàŋa shÿɔ̀g palÿɔ́ʼncù la kwéte kwàʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie ncù la ne ńgáʼa?
en: How the mighty have fallen in the thick of battle!

ngiemboon: N ne ḿmÿɔgɔ tɛʼ ńtí gú mbà fɛ̌ wɔ̀ɔn Jÿonataŋ.
en: I grieve for you, Jonathan, my brother.

ngiemboon: Mélàʼakɔ́ yɔɔn ngàŋa zeŋe nnɛ́ pie ée palÿɔ́ʼncù la kwéte?
en: How the mighty have fallen
